alert.note: Alert for South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 26 at 2:24AM MST until December 27 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations generally 1 to 3 inches with 4 to 8 inches possible over extreme northwestern Laramie County. Winds gusting as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...South Laramie Range Foothills including Interstate 80 west of Cheyenne between Mile Markers 345 and 355. * WHEN...Until 5 AM MST Wednesday. The worst conditions are expected through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and poor visibilities in falling and blowing snow. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A Blizzard Warning is in effect over the Interstate 80 Summit. A High Wind Warning is also in effect for the same time period.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
